originalTitle: Catch of the day: Pictures from spectacular Nigerian fishing festival
title: Big Fish, Big Fun, Big Peace in Nigeria!
content:
Hello from Africa!

Hi everyone! It's your kid-friendly reporter here. Guess what? We have some super exciting news from a country called Nigeria! Nigeria is a big, beautiful country in Africa. It's on our amazing continent! Today, we are talking about a very special party, a celebration! It's called a fishing festival. Imagine a big day where everyone comes together for fun, fish, and friendship! It's like a giant picnic with a cool contest.

What is a Fishing Festival?

A festival is a happy time. People celebrate something important. This festival is all about fishing! Fishing means catching fish from a river or a lake. People use rods, nets, or even their hands sometimes! In Nigeria, people gathered by a big river. They were ready for a super fun fishing challenge. It's a very old tradition that families have done for many, many years. It is a special part of their culture. Did you know? Nigeria is home to many different kinds of animals, including big fish like catfish in its rivers! Some can be very heavy!

Where is This Happening?

This amazing festival is happening in Nigeria! Nigeria is a country on our continent, Africa. It has sunny weather and lots of friendly people. It is in West Africa. The festival takes place in places near water, like rivers or lakes. Imagine blue water shining in the sun, and lots of people smiling and laughing. It is usually held in the springtime after the dry season. Did you know? Nigeria is sometimes called 'the Giant of Africa' because it has so many people! It is a very big country with many different languages and cultures. Did you know? The festival we are talking about is very famous and is called the Argungu Fishing Festival. It has been happening for almost 90 years!

The Big Fishing Contest!

This festival has a very special part: a fishing contest! A contest is like a game where people try to be the best. Here, people try to catch the biggest fish! Imagine how exciting that must be! Imagine lots of people standing by the river. They have their fishing rods or nets ready. Everyone is waiting for the signal to start. It's a little bit like a race, but for fish! Everyone wants to catch the prize-winning fish. When the signal goes, everyone tries their best. They cast their lines into the water. They wait patiently. Sometimes they wait for a long time, sometimes a fish bites quickly! It takes skill and a bit of luck! It's very exciting! Everyone cheers for their friends and family. When someone catches a big fish, everyone claps and smiles. It’s a wonderful sight! The person with the heaviest fish wins a special prize. Did you know? Some of the fish caught at this festival can weigh more than 70 kilograms! That's heavier than a grown-up! Did you know? Fishing is a skill that many people in Africa learn from their parents and grandparents. It helps them get food and is an important part of their way of life!

Why Do They Do This? (It's About Peace!)

Now, here is the most important part. This festival is not just about catching fish. It's about something even more special: peace! What is peace? Peace means being kind to each other. It means not fighting. It means being friends and helping each other. It's when everyone feels safe and happy. Sometimes, people in different towns or villages might have small arguments. This festival helps everyone remember to be friends again. It helps them put their differences aside. When people come together for this fun day, they laugh together. They eat together. They play together. This helps them forget any small arguments they had. They remember that they are all one community. It's like a big 'friendship party'! They shake hands, they share stories, and they remember that they are all one big family. The fishing contest helps them play fair and be good sports, which is also a way to build peace. Did you know? When we are kind to our friends, we are helping to make peace! Every small act of kindness makes the world a better, more peaceful place. Did you know? Festivals like this help people keep their traditions alive and teach them to new generations. It's like passing down a special family recipe for happiness and harmony!

More Fun Things to See!

Besides the fishing contest, there are other super cool things at the festival! Imagine lots of music playing. People dance to the happy tunes. The sounds fill the air with joy! There is yummy food to eat! Traditional African food, maybe some grilled fish from the river! It smells so good and everyone shares. People tell stories, too. Old stories about their grand-grandparents and how they used to fish. These stories teach important lessons and make everyone laugh or think. Everyone wears their most colorful clothes. It’s a happy, bright day filled with smiles and laughter. It's a time for everyone to feel proud of their culture and share it with others. Did you know? Music and dancing are a very important part of many celebrations in Africa! It's a way to express joy, tell stories without words, and bring people together.

A Happy Ending!

So, this fishing festival in Nigeria is more than just catching fish. It's a super special day where friends and neighbors come together. They compete, they laugh, and most importantly, they make peace. It shows us that even simple fun, like fishing, can bring people closer. It helps them remember to be kind and friendly to everyone, making their communities stronger and happier. What a wonderful way to celebrate! Let’s all try to be like the people at the festival and spread peace and friendship wherever we go!
summary: People in Nigeria have a special fishing festival where they catch big fish, share happy times, and remember to be friends and live in peace with everyone.
whyMatters: This festival is important because it brings people from different places together to have fun and helps them be kind to each other, making peace in their communities and keeping old traditions alive.

originalTitle: Rare prison sentences handed to Cameroon soldiers after killing of 21 civilians
title: Justice for Everyone! Rules Matter in Cameroon!
content:
Hello from Cameroon!

Hi there, amazing friends! It's your kid-friendly news reporter, coming to you live from beautiful Africa! Today, I have a very important story from a country called Cameroon. Cameroon is a wonderful place in Central Africa, full of sunshine, tall trees, and friendly faces. It's so special that people sometimes call it "Africa in miniature" because it has so many different kinds of places, like beaches, mountains, and even thick forests where animals like gorillas and elephants live! In Cameroon, just like in your neighborhood, there are many people. These people speak different languages. Imagine if some of your friends spoke one language, and other friends spoke another! In Cameroon, some people speak French, and some people speak English. Everyone lives together, sharing their beautiful country and helping each other.

What Happened? A Sad Day

Now, sometimes, even in the most beautiful places, sad things can happen. A little while ago, in a part of Cameroon where many people speak English (we call this the "Anglophone region"), something very, very sad took place. It's like when a big family has a disagreement, but much bigger and more serious. In this region, some grown-ups who are called soldiers did something wrong. Soldiers are usually heroes! They are people who wear special uniforms and are supposed to be very brave and help keep everyone safe. Their job is to protect their country and all the people in it. But on this sad day, some soldiers made a very big mistake. Instead of keeping people safe, they hurt some people. These people were not soldiers; they were just regular people, like your mum, dad, brothers, sisters, or grandparents. We call these regular people "civilians." Sadly, 21 civilians were hurt very badly, and some of them even lost their lives. This was a very, very sad day for many families in Cameroon. Did you know? Soldiers in many countries learn special skills and train very hard to protect people and keep peace. They work to make sure their country is safe!

What Are Soldiers For?

Let's talk a little more about soldiers and their important job. Why do we have soldiers? Soldiers are like super-helpers for a country. Their biggest job is to protect everyone inside the country and make sure the country is safe from danger. Imagine your home; soldiers are like the people who make sure no one bad comes into the house and that everyone inside is safe and happy. Soldiers are given a lot of power to do their job, but with that power comes a lot of important rules. They are supposed to follow very strict rules and be very careful with how they use their power. Every soldier promises to protect civilians and follow the rules of their country. When they don't follow these rules, especially rules about not hurting people, it's a very serious problem. It's like when you play a game, and someone doesn't follow the rules of the game. It spoils the fun for everyone, and it's not fair. But what happened in Cameroon was much, much more serious than a game. Did you know? Countries all over Africa have armies and soldiers who work hard every single day to keep their people safe and their borders secure!

Rules Are for Everyone!

Now, here's a very important lesson that this story teaches us: Rules are for everyone! No matter if you are a little kid, a big grown-up, a teacher, a farmer, or even a soldier, everyone must follow the rules. Why do we have rules? Rules help us live together happily and safely. They tell us what we should do and what we shouldn't do. They are like a guide to being good and safe! Think about the rules at your school. You have rules like "be kind to your friends" or "don't run in the corridors." These rules keep you safe from bumps and falls, and help everyone learn and play nicely. It's the same in a country, but on a much bigger scale! When someone breaks a rule, especially a very big and important rule like hurting someone, there are consequences. "Consequences" mean what happens after you do something. If you break a toy, the consequence might be that you can't play with it anymore. If you hurt someone, the consequences are much more serious and important. Did you know? The Universal Declaration of Human Rights is a very important paper that says everyone, everywhere, no matter where they live, has the right to be safe and treated fairly. That means you, me, and everyone in Cameroon!

Good News: Justice Happens!

Even though what happened was very sad, there is some very good news! In Cameroon, just like in many places around the world, there are special places called courts. A court is where judges (who are like super-smart problem solvers and decision-makers) listen carefully to what happened and decide what is fair. It's like when your parents help you and your friend solve a problem about who gets to play with a toy, but much bigger and more formal. The three soldiers who did those bad things went to court. The judges listened very carefully to everything that happened. And guess what? The judges decided that these soldiers had broken very, very important rules. They had done something very wrong that hurt innocent people. So, the judges decided that these soldiers should go to "jail." Jail is a special place where grown-ups go if they break very big rules. They go there to think about what they did, to learn from their mistakes, and for a long time, they can't hurt anyone else. It's a way to keep everyone safe and to show that breaking rules has serious consequences. This decision was very important. It means that even if you are a soldier, you cannot break the rules and hurt people. Everyone is equal in the eyes of the law, no matter who they are. It means that justice was served. "Justice" means that what is fair and right has happened. It means that even though a very sad thing happened, the people who did it are being held responsible for their actions. It helps make things right again as much as possible. Did you know? In many African countries, there are special courts for different kinds of problems, just like how you might have different teachers for different subjects at school!

Why This is Important for All of Us

Why is this story so important for you and me, all the way across Africa? It teaches us a very big lesson. It teaches us that rules are important for *everyone* in a country. It teaches us that if someone does something wrong, especially something that hurts others, they will face consequences. It tells us that even when sad things happen, there are always people working very hard to make things right and fair for everyone. This story shows that Cameroon is a country that believes in fairness and in making sure everyone is safe. When the soldiers were sent to jail, it sent a clear message to everyone: you must follow the rules, and you must protect civilians, not hurt them. It helps make sure that sad things like this don't happen again. It also brings a little bit of peace and comfort to the families who were sad, knowing that justice has been done. It also reminds us that we should always speak up if we see something wrong. And that grown-ups in charge, like judges and leaders, work hard every day to make sure their countries are safe and fair places for children like you to grow up healthy and happy. Did you know? Many countries in Africa are working hard every day to make sure their citizens live in peace and safety, making our continent a better place for everyone!

Let's Keep Learning!

So, my young friends, this story from Cameroon is a reminder that rules keep us safe, justice is important, and even when sad things happen, good people work to make things right. Let's all remember to be kind, follow the rules, and help each other stay safe. And let's keep learning about the amazing and strong countries of Africa! Until next time, stay curious and kind!
summary: In Cameroon, three soldiers were sent to jail for hurting civilians, which shows that everyone, even soldiers, must follow the rules and that justice makes things fair for everyone.
whyMatters: This is important because it teaches us that rules keep everyone safe and happy, and when someone breaks big rules, especially rules about hurting people, they will face consequences, helping make sure fairness and safety for everyone in the country.

title: South African farmers fear devastation as foot-and-mouth takes hold
content: The government has begun a vaccination programme but officials have been blamed for a slow response.

title: Trump, JD Vance vilify ‘lawless’ Supreme Court justices over tariff ruling
content: President Trump calls Supreme Court justices an 'embarrassment to their families' in 45-minute address to media.

originalTitle: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 1,458
title: News from Far Away: Friends Helping Friends!
content:
Hello from Your African Reporter!

Hi everyone! It's me, your friendly reporter from Africa! I'm here to share some news with you from a place very far away. Sometimes, things happen in the world that can make us feel a little bit sad, but it's important to know that many good people are always trying to help. Today, we're talking about a country called Ukraine.

What's Happening Far Away?

Imagine two friends having a very, very big argument. So big that they stop playing nicely. This is a bit like what happened between two countries, Ukraine and Russia. They had a big disagreement, and sometimes, when countries have big disagreements, it's called a 'war'. A war is when people fight, and it makes many people sad. Homes can get broken, and children might have to leave their schools and toys behind. **Did you know?** Ukraine is a big country in a part of the world called Europe. It has beautiful farms and cities, just like our homes here in Africa!

What is Day 1,458 About?

Now, when we say 'Day 1,458', it means that a lot of days have passed since this big disagreement started. That's more than three years! Every day, brave people work hard to make things better. On day 1,458, just like on many other days, good people continued to help in many different ways. Imagine waking up in the morning and thinking, "How can I help someone today?" That's what many people in Ukraine and around the world are doing every single day. They are thinking about how to bring smiles back and make things safe again.

Friends Helping Friends!

Even though the big disagreement is happening, there are so many people who are like superheroes! They come from all over the world, bringing kindness and help. They want everyone in Ukraine to be safe and happy. Some of these helpers are bringing food for families. Imagine not having enough food to eat – it would be very hard. So, kind people make sure children and their families get warm meals and healthy snacks. They pack big boxes full of yummy things. **Did you know?** When people send food and other important things to help, it's called 'humanitarian aid'. It's like sending a big hug in a box!

Food and Fun for Children

On day 1,458, one of the most important things was making sure children were safe and had some fun. When homes are not safe, some children have to move to new places with their families. These children are sometimes called 'people who moved for safety' or 'refugees'. They need new places to sleep and play. Helpers set up safe places where children can play games, draw pictures, and even learn a little. They brought new toys – colourful balls, building blocks, and cuddly teddy bears. Because even when things are tough, children need to play and laugh! **Did you know?** Play is very important for children. It helps them feel better and learn new things, even when they are going through a difficult time.

Doctors and Brave Helpers

Sometimes, when there is a big disagreement, people get hurt or sick. Brave doctors and nurses are there to help them. On day 1,458, just like every day, these amazing helpers were taking care of everyone who needed medicine or a bandage. They are like real-life superheroes, making sure people feel better. Other helpers were busy finding safe places for families to stay. Imagine your home is broken, and you need a new place to sleep. These helpers found warm beds and safe rooms so families could rest and feel secure. They gave out blankets to keep everyone warm, especially during cold nights.

Thinking About Peace

Every single day, people around the world hope for 'peace'. Peace means when everyone is friends again, there are no more fights, and everyone can play and learn safely. It means homes can be built again, and families can be together without worry. On day 1,458, many people were still talking and trying to find a way to stop the big disagreement. They were trying to help the two countries become friends again. It's a very hard job, but many grown-ups are working hard to make it happen. **Did you know?** Many countries, even our neighbours here in Africa, send their good wishes and help to Ukraine. We all want peace for everyone!

Why This is Important for All of Us

Even though Ukraine is far away, what happens there matters to all of us. When people help each other, it shows that we are all part of one big family on Earth. It reminds us to be kind and helpful to our friends and neighbours too. It teaches us that even when things are difficult, there is always hope. There are always people who care and will try their best to make the world a better, safer, and happier place for everyone, especially for children.

Let's Hope for Sunshine!

So, on day 1,458, the story was about kindness, bravery, and hope. It was about people making sure children had food, safe places to play, and warm beds. It was about doctors helping the sick and wounded. It was about everyone wishing for the big disagreement to stop and for peace to come back. Let's all hope that soon, the sun will shine brightly over Ukraine, and all the children there can go back to their schools, play with their friends, and live in safe, happy homes. And remember, even a small act of kindness from you can make a big difference in the world!
summary: On day 1,458 of a big disagreement far away in Ukraine, kind people from all over the world helped children and families by giving them food, toys, safe places to stay, and wishing for peace.
whyMatters: This story matters because it shows us that even when big problems happen, people are always ready to help each other, especially children, and that we should all hope for peace and be kind to everyone.

title: US military says it attacked vessel in Pacific Ocean, killing three people
content: US military's Southern Command (SOUTHCOM) claimed the vessel was involved in drug trafficking, without providing proof.

content: The six justices who voted against the tariffs, dealing a major blow to his signature economic policy, should be "absolutely ashamed", Trump said.

title: Trump says he is considering limited military strike on Iran

title: Mourinho made 'unacceptable, huge mistake' - Kompany
content: Bayern Munich boss Vincent Kompany says Jose Mourinho made a "huge mistake" with his "unacceptable" post-match comments after the alleged racial abuse of Real Madrid winger Vinicius Jr.

originalTitle: Ratcliffe avoids FA charge over immigration comments
title: Ratcliffe avoids FA charge over immigration comments
content: Manchester United co-owner Sir Jim Ratcliffe's claims the UK has been "colonised by immigrants" will not lead to any sanction by the Football Association.

originalTitle: Relegated in February? Why Sheff Wed are on brink of history
title: Relegated in February? Why Sheff Wed are on brink of history
content: Sheffield Wednesday are on the brink of becoming the first team in English Football League history to be relegated in February.
